description: Dive into "Shopping Adventures in Vibrant Pattaya" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Shopping Adventures in Vibrant Pattaya

places.generalDescription: Central Pattaya is home to the renowned Central Festival Shopping Mall, a popular destination for both tourists and locals. Opened in 2009, this modern mall offers a beachfront location with a stunning view of Pattaya Bay. Visitors can enjoy a wide range of international brand clothing, diverse dining options, and entertainment facilities including a cinema, bowling alley, and children's arcade.

sources.snippet: Central Festival Pattaya, opened in 2009, is Asia’s largest natural beachfront shopping complex, comprising a shopping mall and the Hilton Pattaya Hotel with 360-degree panorama view of Pattaya Beach. It's designed to cater to both locals and tourists by providing a comprehensive shopping experience that blends leisure, entertainment, and convenience. The project has created a modern and lively lifestyle center in Pattaya while becoming one of the best Pattaya shopping places.
sources.shortName: Pattaya Shopping Places: Market to Top Malls

sources.snippet: Central Festival Shopping Mall is the flagship shopping destination in Pattaya and is constantly popular with a large variety of international brand clothing, eating options and all-weather entertainment, such as a cinema, bowling and children's arcade. The transportation is very convenient, and the shopping mall is very large. There is also a big BIG C supermarket that has everything you need to eat.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Shopping Places in Pattaya, Where to Buy in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Started in 2009, this beachfront mall has multiple stores of international and local brands. Offering the view of Pattaya Bay, it gives a unique shopping experience to its visitors. There are various eating outlets and entertainment options such as a cinema, children’s arcade, and bowling area where you can take a break while shopping.
sources.shortName: 11 Shopping Malls in Pattaya Perfect for Shopaholics in 2024

sources.snippet: Central Festival Pattaya is located within the grounds of one of the most prominent high-rise buildings in the heart of Beach Road Pattaya. Opened and put into operation since 2002, now has nearly 20 years of operation. However, this business center still retains its elegance and charm.
sources.shortName: Top 3 Best Shopping Malls Must Visit In Pattaya

sources.snippet: Central Festival Pattaya and Central Marina Pattaya are the two largest and plushest shopping Malls in the city. Both offer a large variety of luxury and affordable shops, market stalls, restaurants, coffee shops, cafes and entertainment options.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Central Center Pattaya is the tallest building in the seaside, which has more than 300 stores. It also has many high street fashion brand, including Calvin Klein, Nautica Zara. and Marks & Spencer, H & M, there are a variety of food stores.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Shopping Malls in Pattaya - Thailand Travel Guide

places.name: Central Pattaya

reviews.text: I recently had the pleasure of visiting Central Pattaya Mall and I must say the experience was outstanding. From the moment I walked in, the ambience was so awesome and welcoming. I highly recommend Central Pattaya to anyone in need of luxury branded shopping. They have nice food options in there. Located at lovely beach front.

This is the biggest mall in Pattaya and during the days we visited there was a pride parade and a fashion show along with it. In the beach side you can find the Mac Donald's and in the back there is a street food market and also in the food court there are lot of fruits and a huge supermarket. It was very convenient for as as our hotel was in a walking distance to this place

I had a great experience at Central Pattaya. It's a well-designed shopping mall with a good mix of tenants, making for an enjoyable time dining and shopping. The entrance stands out-it has a more elegant and refined feel compared to the chaotic energy of the Bangkok location. There's a certain old-money charm to it that adds to the overall experience.

places.address: 333/102 Pattaya Sai Song Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Terminal 21 Pattaya, established in 2018, is a renowned department store located in the heart of Pattaya City. This retail mall follows the concept of 'Happiness of the East' and features a 'World Market Street' theme that brings together iconic cities from around the world under one roof, including Paris, London, Italy, Tokyo, San Francisco, and Hollywood.

sources.snippet: Another one of Pattaya shopping places to be mentioned is Terminal 21 Pattaya, opened in 2018, is a famous department store, which is a new Landmark in the heart of Pattaya City with the concept that has gathered many famous places from around the world to be in one place. Terminal 21 Pattaya was offered as a retail mall with the theme of "Happiness of the East" that brings together a place of happiness from across the world in the concept of "World Market Street". It has gathered iconic towns from across the world to form a mall, including Paris, London, Italy, Tokyo, San Francisco, and Hollywood.
sources.shortName: Pattaya Shopping Places: Market to Top Malls

sources.snippet: Terminal 21 Pattaya takes you on an international shopping expedition without ever having to leave the city. Styled to mirror an airport, each floor of this unique mall represents a different world city, offering shoppers a thematic experience from the canals of Venice to the bustling streets of Tokyo. Terminal 21 houses a wide assortment of fashion, cosmetics, and electronics alongside a diverse food court serving global cuisines.
sources.shortName: Explore Pattaya's Top 5 Shopping Malls: A Shopaholic's Dream

sources.snippet: Terminal 21 Pattaya is known for its youthful eating paradise with diverse and rich cuisines. In addition, the fashion shops here do not carry a certain characteristic such as being too luxurious or popular but here you can buy any item you want. There are a lot of on-site activities, including shopping, entertainment, eating and drinking, sure to have enough fun to please your whole family.
sources.shortName: Top 3 Best Shopping Malls Must Visit In Pattaya

sources.snippet: Terminal 21 Pattaya offers a unique shopping experience with its airport terminal theme, where each floor is designed to represent a different city, such as Paris, London, Tokyo, and San Francisco. This thematic approach provides an immersive shopping experience in Pattaya, making it a fun destination for all ages, and making it one of the best places for shopping in Pattaya.
sources.shortName: A Guide for Travelers in 2025

sources.snippet: Welcome to Terminal 21 Pattaya, where your shopping journey takes you around the world. This unique shopping center Pattaya Thailand offers a vibrant shopping and dining experience inspired by global destinations like Tokyo, London, and Paris. As you explore its themed floors, you'll feel like a globe-trotter without leaving Pattaya.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya: Get Ready to Shop in Style

sources.snippet: Terminal 21 Pattaya is one of the newest and largest shopping malls in the city. It is located in the heart of Pattaya and is easily accessible by public transportation. The mall is designed like an airport terminal, with each floor representing a different country, including Japan, England, France, and the United States.
sources.shortName: Exploring Pattaya's Best Shopping Malls: From Terminal 21 to Mike Shopping Mall

sources.snippet: To know: Terminal 21 Mall is the biggest shopping mall in Pattaya!. There are different shops that you will enjoy going here and there shopping from, and it will be a marvelous moment you can live with your close ones!. To do: You’ll be absolutely satisfied by the unique charm the mall has to offer.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Terminal 21 Pattaya offers an invitation to traverse the globe in a day. Each level, themed after different world cities from Paris to Tokyo, propels you on a global retail odyssey, complemented by an eclectic mix of products and cuisines.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Pattaya Guide

sources.siteName: โรงแรมแอมเบอร์ พัทยา
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Pattaya Guide
One of the biggest mall in Pattaya - Terminal

places.name: Terminal 21 Pattaya

reviews.text: This is such a fun shopping centre, each floor is a different city, with elements of that city all throughout, for example there is an Eiffel Tower on the French floor, and a Golden Gate Bridge on the San Francisco floor. The toilets on the London floor are really cool, and have the Japanese toilets that are heated and have all the different squirting positions. The food hall on the top floor is fabulous. You have to buy a card with money on it to pay at all these food stalls, but don't worry you'll get refunded with the balance at the end of it. The prices of the food are so cheap and the ones that we tried were so delicious. It is worth visiting just for the food hall itself.

Loved this place. And in my opinion, it's better for shopping compared to the one in Bangkok. Like all terminal 21, each floor has separate country themed. It has shops of all sorts and ranges, from branded to local. Prices are fixed but they will give you discount. Some nice souvenirs shops are also available. Some restaurants are just absolutely amazing. It has movie theatre and sometimes there are events/shows going on in ground floor. Overall, it's good place to hang around even if you are not big on shopping.

Excellently maintained shopping mall. Novel interior design. The concept of the world's major cities under a single roof is awesome. The food court has a variety of items at an affordable rate. Card purchase centre in the food court provides easy purchase of items. Tourists can purchase Thai items at an affordable rate from Thai village on the third floor.

places.address: 777, 1, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Pattaya Night Bazaar is a bustling market featuring over 250 stalls offering a wide range of products including clothing, shoes, luggage, jewelry, and Thai souvenirs. The market provides a covered and air-conditioned shopping experience, making it more comfortable for visitors. While it is known as a night bazaar, the shops are also open during the day with local vendors setting up their stalls at night. Visitors can enjoy leisurely shopping without being exhausted by the sun.

sources.snippet: It is the largest and most popular street market in Pattaya. It's Pattaya's small version of Bangkok's Chatuchak Market or Chiang Mai's Night Bazaar, also one of the famous Pattaya shopping places. Whether you want to try traditional Thai street cuisine or buy souvenirs to take home from Pattaya, you won't be disappointed.
sources.shortName: Pattaya Shopping Places: Market to Top Malls

sources.snippet: The Pattaya Night Bazaar is oddly named as it seems to be open all day. It’s an in a large building on Second Road, keeping you out of the sun as you peruse through the different shops. Like most markets, it has an assorted selection goods from soaps, candles, luggage, clothing, and more.
sources.shortName: The Best Shopping in Pattaya – From Malls to Markets

sources.snippet: The supplier sales of all commodities that all the things you usually find in a street market, including discount clothing, souvenirs, mobile phone accessories and small appliances. There are some extra features, such as tailor shop stalls and luggage.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Shopping Malls in Pattaya - Thailand Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Unlike Thepprasit Night Market, this one remains open throughout the week. Though the name says that its a night bazaar; but it is open all day long. It is sometimes referred to as ‘Made in Thailand’ market.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya 2024 - 19 Places to Shop & What to Buy

sources.snippet: Pattaya Night Bazaar is a must-visit for those who love night markets. This market offers a wide variety of products at reasonable prices. You can find clothes, accessories, bags, and many other items.
sources.shortName: A Guide for Travelers in 2025

places.name: Pattaya Night Bazaar

reviews.text:
This is the Bazaar for tourists to buy things/gifts for their family members waiting at home.
You can buy different types of items here like stationery, household items and clothes as well.
It was quite a good experience of street shopping under one roof.
With budget friendly prices, you can get everything you want.

It's a delightful destination brimming with an array of delicious local cuisine, vibrant clothing, fresh fruits, and unique collectibles. Each stall and shop offers a treasure trove of flavors and colorful designs, making it a true feast for the senses.

FOOD TIP / REVIEW:

In the back are 3-4 small restaurants located. I definitely recommend the one in the middle (see photo). The food and service are great! Please go and try their sea food sauce, its the greatest!! Its a lemon-coriander-chilli type sauce (a bit spicy). Staff and the cook were very friendly and helpful as we were also with children.

places.address: 519/106 หมู่ที่ 10, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Central Marina is a shopping center conveniently located near S@S Pattaya. It has a unique design resembling a fisherman's village and offers various amenities such as a cinema, 24-hour McDonald's, Big C supermarket, and a Nike factory outlet. The mall also features popular dining options like Starbucks, MK, Auntie Anne's, Swensen's, and Pizza Hut.

sources.snippet: Central Marina Pattaya is a vibrant addition to the landscape of shopping malls in Pattaya, strategically located in the Bang Lamung district. This modern shopping center spans three floors and features a diverse array of retail shops, dining options, and entertainment facilities, including a six-screen cinema. Central Marina caters to a wide demographic, offering everything from high-end fashion brands to local boutiques, making it an ideal destination for both residents and tourists.
sources.shortName: The best Shopping malls in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Formerly known as Central Center Pattaya, this place has some great eateries such as Starbucks, a Sichuan restaurant, a central bar offering drinks, and other stalls offering Thai cheeseburgers and hamburgers, among many other varieties of food. Most nights, it also has live music sessions for visitors. Whether you are looking for some affordable shopping or quality products at cheap prices, it has it all.
sources.shortName: 11 Shopping Malls in Pattaya Perfect for Shopaholics in 2024

sources.snippet: Having been renovated in 2017, Central Marina (formerly Central Centre) has seen a remarkable increase in popularity. The décor, the shops and definitely the parking have improved dramatically. Located on Pattaya 2nd Road, Central Marina might not have to top brands of its larger sibling but it still has plenty to offer in terms of shops, restaurants and once again entertainment.
sources.shortName: Top 4 Shopping Malls in Pattaya

sources.snippet: If you're looking for the right combination of relaxation and shopping experience, Central Marina in Pattaya is among the best places to visit in Thailand. Its lovely waterfront view and diverse selection of stores will enchant you. This shopping paradise has it all, whether you're looking for brand labels or local crafts.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya: Get Ready to Shop in Style

sources.snippet: Central Marina Pattaya is a smaller shopping mall located in North Pattaya. It is known for its modern and stylish design, and has a range of shops, including fashion, beauty, and electronics. The mall also has a cinema, a food court, and a supermarket.
sources.shortName: Exploring Pattaya's Best Shopping Malls: From Terminal 21 to Mike Shopping Mall

sources.snippet: Central Marina offers a high-end shopping in Pattaya experience. The mall is known for its elegant ambiance and a wide range of luxury brands. You can find top-notch fashion stores, jewellery shops, and international brands.
sources.shortName: A Guide for Travelers in 2025

places.name: Central Marina Outlet

reviews.text: It is a pretty big mall, not massive like a Terminal 21 , But it has everything you need - a massive 2 story Big C supermarket, many outlets like Nike, Puma, Adidas, etc., Leftover seasonal items like shoes, clothes, accessories sold for cheap. They also got a Boots, local pharmacy, phone shops, etc. Worth a visit. Bought a nice Nike bag on sale at the outlet.

I really haven't been here for many years, I even forgot about until I was curious to look more carefully for new places. Car park was plenty and free which is linked to the main building (from second floor). It was nice, quiet and enjoyable, with a peaceful feel to it. well air-conditioned and beautifully decorated interior. There are many shops and stall offering various products from quick bites to electronic products and cosmetics, etc.
Visiting the bank wouldn't have been faster anywhere else, with zero waiting time.
Loved it and loved its simplicity and peacefulness.

Nice mall near where I'm staying. I ate some good Thai food in the food court for lunch and had a stroll around to do some shopping. They have an ongoing sale on nikes, addidas, puma brand on the second floor. Check it out.

places.address: 78/54 Pattaya Sai Song Rd, Pattaya City, Amphoe Bang Lamung, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20260, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Royal Garden Plaza is a vibrant mall in Pattaya that introduced the concept of an entertainment mall. It offers a mix of family attractions, renowned museums, dining options, and international brand stores. The mall spans three floors and features well-known international and Thai clothing brands, 4D cinemas, beauty salons, and sports outlets. Visitors can also admire an eye-catching mock airplane at the entrance on 2nd Road.

sources.snippet:
Royal 
Garden Plaza is a stylish, modern shopping mall, located between Beach Road and 2nd Road in Central Pattaya, close to Walking Street, with entrances from both - the most impressive entrance being on the 2nd Road under the airplane that is half hanging out of the building, which belongs to Ripley's Believe It or Not museum. Being directly on the beach this Mall is in a great location and offers tourists a welcome relief from the hot sun, being air-conditioned throughout and offers great shopping in Pattaya. This shopping mall offers a large range of shops and stalls over it's four floors, from high end international retailers to local retailers, you can expect to find what you need here and there are plenty of shops to browse.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza was the originator of the ‘entertainment mall' concept in Pattaya, bringing together family attractions and activities, a selection of restaurants, and international brand shopping, and it is still a blast of fresh, air-conditioned air to the beach city's shopping scene. Occupying the full block between Beach Road and 2nd Road in Central Pattaya, the mall can be accessed from either side, but for the most impressive facade, go to the 2nd Road entrance and walk underneath the eye catching mock airplane that is half hanging out of the upper floors of the shopping centre. The plane belongs to Ripley's Believe It or Not, a museum of oddball finds, unique curios and a central attraction at the mall.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya | Mövenpick Hotels & Resorts Thailand

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza was the originator of the ‘entertainment mall' concept in Pattaya, bringing together family attractions and activities, a selection of restaurants, and international brands, and it is still a blast of fresh, air-conditioned air to the beach city's shopping scene. Occupying the full block between Beach Road and 2nd Road in Central Pattaya, the mall can be accessed from either side, but for the most impressive facade, go to the 2nd Road entrance and walk underneath the eye catching mock airplane that is half hanging out of the upper floors of the shopping centre. The plane belongs to Ripley's Believe It or Not, a museum of oddball finds, unique curios and a central attraction at the mall.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya | Mövenpick Hotels & Resorts Thailand

sources.snippet: This mall is the most popular, with a total of 3 floors, international brands and Thai brand-name clothing stores, 4D cinemas, cosmetics stores, beauty salons and hair salons. There is an impressive range of shops with something for all the family. Fashionists will enjoy the latest trends in Esprit, Guess, and Jaspal (a popular Thai brand), while a large Super Sport outlet is stocked with a range of sporting goods and beachwear.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Shopping Places in Pattaya, Where to Buy in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Considered a prominent shopping mall because it takes the form of a bright red plane jutting out from Second Road, accompanied by a ball with yellow and white protruding from the roof house. Different from Central Festival Pattaya, which concentrates on luxury and famous shops in the world. At Royal Garden Plaza Pattaya are impressive options with stylish, street-style boutiques like Levis, Converse, Von Dutch and more.
sources.shortName: Top 3 Best Shopping Malls Must Visit In Pattaya

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza is the oldest shopping center in Pattaya with the most modern design. The building will amaze with its construction: the tail of a huge red airplane sticks out of the wall and a huge yellow ball rises on the roof. There are shops with various goods, children's center "Ripley's Entertainment World", food court with international cafes on the 4 floors of the complex.
sources.shortName: Top_shops_in_Pattaya

sources.snippet: This is one of the most popular places for shopping in Pattaya (you’ll surely know once you’re there). It all starts with the first glimpse of the entrance. The first thing that catches your eye will be a bright yellow colored balloon jutting out of the roof and a red aircraft half hanging out of the building (enter from the 2nd road entrance to witness this fantastic setup).
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya 2024 - 19 Places to Shop & What to Buy

sources.snippet: To know: Royal Garden Plaza Mall is a perfect option to make when picking out your destination as it is the best shopping mall Pattaya!. Nothing beats having a long tour inside the mall with your close ones!. To do: Get ready, because you are about to find a plethora of fabulous clothing stores and shoe stores alongside a supermarket that has all of your daily requirements.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza is an older shopping mall in Pattaya, but it is still a popular destination for tourists looking for local souvenirs and unique gifts. It is located on Beach Road and has over 100 shops, including clothing, jewelry, and handicrafts. The mall is also home to Ripley’s Believe It or Not Museum and a 4D cinema.
sources.shortName: Exploring Pattaya's Best Shopping Malls: From Terminal 21 to Mike Shopping Mall

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza is not just another mall; it’s an entertainment complex offering families a unique shopping experience. With its distinctive red aeroplane protruding from the facade, the mall houses Ripley’s Believe It or Not!. Museum, a haunted adventure ride, and a wax museum, among other attractions.
sources.shortName: Explore Pattaya's Top 5 Shopping Malls: A Shopaholic's Dream

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza is next to The Marriot Hotel on Pattaya 2nd Road with access also available from Beach Road. This shopping mall is not as busy as the previous two mentioned but still has a good selection of shops, restaurants and coffee shops. Royal Garden Plaza is home to Ripley’s “Believe or Not!
sources.shortName: Top 4 Shopping Malls in Pattaya

sources.snippet: What we mean by that is the age of Royal Garden Plaza Pattaya is the oldest, but its look is completely not. It’s beautiful and attractive instead. This shopping center not only offers a wide range of products and restaurants but it also offers activities for both children and adult visitors.
sources.siteName: Thailand Event Guide: Top Festivals, Concerts & Cultural Experiences
sources.shortName: 4 Pattaya Shopping Malls

sources.snippet: The interesting museum occupies most of the floor of Royal Garden Plaza Pattaya. There are Levi's, Dutch and Von Esprit mall, Converse and other high street brands. Besides, there are impressive souvenirs, jewelry, Beachwear, appliances and catering establishments.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Shopping Malls in Pattaya - Thailand Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza melds fun with shopping in an extraordinary setting. Its facade, adorned by a distinctive red airplane, marks an indelible landmark. Within, a blend of shopping, dining, and entertainment awaits, including the famed Ripley’s Believe It or Not!
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Pattaya Guide

sources.siteName: โรงแรมแอมเบอร์ พัทยา
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Pattaya Guide

sources.snippet: Royal Garden Plaza is known for its quirky facade featuring a model aeroplane crashing into the building. This Pattaya shopping mall offers a mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment, making it a unique destination for visitors.
sources.shortName: A Guide for Travelers in 2025

sources.snippet: Situated on the Beach Road, this mall is an architectural masterpiece on one of the beaches in Pattaya. You can shop at designer boutiques and be amazed at Ripley's Believe It or Not!. Museum and wax museum.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya: Get Ready to Shop in Style

sources.snippet: The Royal Garden Plaza, located along Beach Road, is famous for the red airplane and bright yellow balloon along the entrance. Both landmarks are part of Ripley’s Believe It or Not!
sources.shortName: The best Pattaya shopping malls

places.name: Royal Garden Plaza

reviews.text: This mall is absolutely beautiful! It has everything-delicious food, a full grocery, great shopping, shoes, and more. Plus, it features amazing entertainment like Ripley's Believe It or Not, just like in Pattaya. A perfect place to relax and enjoy your day!

One of Pattaya's older plazas but still attractive in its way.  Plenty of dining options, cinemas and shopping, and it's not as crowded as the newer plazas

Of course it has Ripley's Experience which is very popular.  Squeaky clean toilets and close to the beach.

A cool and refreshing place to walk around.

A well-equipped mall with a mix of branded and local shops, offering plenty of variety. Conveniently located right next to the bustling Walking Street, making it easily accessible for a quick stop or a leisurely browse.

places.address: 218 Beach Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Big C Extra Pattaya 3, also known as Central Pattaya, is a diverse mall offering a wide range of food, drinks, and shopping options all in one place. The bakery within the mall has gained recognition for its exceptional bread and pastries, maintaining high standards that have earned it a strong reputation. Additionally, the mall features a grocery store, department store, and various food and drink counters catering to customers with different budgets while offering good quality products.

sources.snippet: Big C Extra, or Central Pattaya, is a mall of varieties when it comes to food, drinks, and, of course, shopping. It has a grocery store, department store, and food and drinks counters, all under a single roof. It has good quality products under the medium to high price range to satisfy customers' needs with different budgets.
sources.shortName: 11 Shopping Malls in Pattaya Perfect for Shopaholics in 2024

places.name: Big C Extra Central Pattaya

reviews.text: Everything here...shops, supermarket and food court. I got some real bargains upstairs cheaper than Pattaya night bazaar! Upstairs you can get some good clothes bargains and 3 freshly made juice drinks for 100 baht!..I thoroughly recommend this place!

Yes any tourists and daily needs available. And also all the house hold items available. Price are very good. Cousterms service is super. For food there are lots of choices at cheap rates. Toilet facilities available free. Many people come here. Even tourists people are in big numbers.
2025 May
The place had everything! We were able to sign up for our internet/wifi, go grocery shopping and also purchase some various bedroom items amongst other things. Very convenient and will be returning.

places.address: 333 หมู่ที่ 9, Central Pattaya Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Index Living Mall Pattaya is a fantastic destination for anyone looking to spruce up their home with stylish furniture and decor. From cozy cushion covers to spacious wardrobes, this mall has it all, boasting impressive quality that ensures your purchases will last. During my recent visit, I was thrilled to discover a big sale event where I found the perfect postural mattress after being guided by an English-speaking salesman who patiently let me test various options.

sources.snippet: It is one of the best places for shopping in Pattaya to purchase furniture and home decor stuff. Right from a cushion covers to wardrobes, you’ll find everything here. Not just that, the quality is also quite impressive, so you do not need to worry much about the same.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya 2024 - 19 Places to Shop & What to Buy

places.name: Index Living Mall Pattaya

reviews.text: Very nice kitchen with good price. Was about 20.000 bath for the kitchen 1.60 meters and about 20.000 bath for electric cooking and air pipe. But the best thing was the workers that come to the house to install. They was the best. They was professionals, polite and happy people to work with. I am pleased.

Beautiful place. We ate at the food court upstairs. The service and food were surprisingly good. We ate then went grocery shopping. After paying for the groceries, I had to go back for a couple more items. The cashier made sure my basket was safe until I returned. The prices were reasonable and all the employees I dealt with were very friendly and helpful.

I like our local index, great service, they even have Canadian employee who is very very helpful, if they are to install anything in your home, be sure you have the best team, but if it takes more than a day then it won't be the next day!! They need to re-book you for some future dates!! Hope they can organize this better.

places.address: 13, 122 หมู่ที่ 9 Sukhumvit Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Harbor Pattaya is a family-friendly leisure center located in central Pattaya. It offers a variety of attractions suitable for all ages, including indoor playgrounds, arcade games, ice and roller skating, climbing walls, and trampolining. One of its main features is Harbor Land, an expansive indoor playground with an ocean-themed climbing frame, numerous slides, obstacle courses, and play features.

sources.snippet: If you're on the hunt for family-friendly entertainment and shopping, Harbor Pattaya Megafun Mall is calling your name. With its vast indoor amusement park, it guarantees fun for all ages. Enjoying the thrilling rides and games, exploring diverse stores and eateries in these shopping malls in Pattaya are among the best things to do in Thailand.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya: Get Ready to Shop in Style

sources.snippet: Now this one’s perfect for children to have a fun day out during their stay in Pattaya. It has plenty of recreation options to keep the kids busy while you shop through the fantastic stores the mall has. From beauty, cosmetics, fashion, jewellery, banking, maternity products to IT and food & beverages, you’ll find everything here.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya 2024 - 19 Places to Shop & What to Buy

sources.snippet: To know: You should certainly head over to Harbor Mall which has a wide reputation for being the best shopping mall at Pattaya!. Get yourself ready to have an amazing time with your loved ones creating a forever memory. To do: You really should check out Harbor Mall!
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya

places.name: Harbor Pattaya

reviews.text: The best family indoor playground I have ever seen. On weekends its almost empty on all 8 floors which feels like you rented the whole building. Crazy feeling. Highly recommended from my side, please try it out!

Mall used to have many stores. Most of them left the mall. Now it's a ghost town. There was a food court here before but that's long gone now. The only reason why this mall is still open is because of the kids area. Don't come here there's nothing to buy or eat.

Oh my god.  This place is a kids' paradise.  The place has 11 zones in total featuring different kinds of games and facilities for the kids.  We started off from the top floor (7/F) from noon time and ended up being the last customer leaving at shop closing time at 9pm.  We bought the 990b day pass but eventually only able to play in 6 of the zones.  Kids (and even adults) energy was totally drained by the end of the day.  Totally recommended for kids especially from age 4 to 10.

places.generalDescription: Tukcom Pattaya is a multi-floor electronics emporium with over 200 shops offering a wide range of computer equipment, phones, and other gadgets. The mall also features a food court, supermarket, specialty stores, and personal care shops to cater to all your shopping needs. It's an ideal destination for gadget enthusiasts and investors interested in setting up an electronics shop. Visitors have praised the store's unique offerings of old electronics and affordable prices.

sources.snippet: If you are a gadget fanatic, then you should definitely give this mall a visit as it has stores full of exciting electronics and all sort of gadgets that you will surely love. It has more than 200 shops dedicated to these products along with electronics and related accessories. It has a supermarket, specialty stores, cosmetics, and personal care shops to fulfill all your shopping requirements.
sources.shortName: 11 Shopping Malls in Pattaya Perfect for Shopaholics in 2024

sources.snippet: This tech mall in Pattaya is a haven for gadget lovers, offering the latest electronics and accessories. From smartphones to gaming gear, it has it all.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya: Get Ready to Shop in Style

places.name: Tukcom South Pattaya

reviews.text: The perfect place to get your electronic repairs, phones tablets computers or whatever it may be there so many businesses under one roof, we went in to get a used iPhone for my wife and got good price compared to other places we visited. but if your looking for a new electronic have no fear you'll find it here. I recommend you visit different places and make an educated decision. Good luck.

My visit to Tukcom South Pattaya was a worthwhile experience, especially if you're into electronics and gadgets. Located on South Pattaya Road just a short walk from Walking Street, it's a multi-story shopping center filled with mobile phones, laptops, accessories, cameras, gaming gear, and repair shops. I found a wide variety of options at competitive prices, and the overall vibe was busy but exciting. There are also good choices for second-hand items and affordable repair services on the upper floors.

The staff were generally helpful, and some shops offered solid guidance on specs and product comparisons. However, I noticed that the quality and authenticity of products can vary from one vendor to another, so it's important to check warranty, seals, and whether the shop is an official dealer. Bargaining is expected in some stalls, but major brands have fixed pricing.

Beyond electronics, there's a McDonald's, Starbucks, and a local food court inside the building, which made the visit more comfortable. There's even a supermarket in the basement, so it's easy to combine tech shopping with casual browsing or a quick meal.

Overall, Tukcom is a good place for tech lovers or tourists looking for electronics in Pattaya. Just stay alert, compare prices, and double-check before buying.

This is a budget hotel in a great locacation with free parking.  Highly recommended.
Staff are super friendly and helpful.
Rooms are big and basic "old" style but everything works and they are clean and functional.
One small gripe. I had to move the fridge to find the only electric socket in the room to charge my phone. That said the bed was comfortable and there was very little outside noise from the thumping street outside.
And there's a charming pool and outside area too.

places.address: 8 หมู่ 10 S Pattaya Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled at the intersection of Thepprasit and Sukhumvit Roads in Jomtien, Outlet Mall Pattaya is a shopping paradise that every fashion enthusiast must explore. As Thailand's first outlet mall, it boasts incredible discounts on high street fashion, with savings reaching up to 70% off original prices. This vibrant two-storey complex features both an Outlet Mall and a Premium Fashion Mall, catering to all your shopping needs.

sources.snippet:
The 
Factory Outlet Mall is located on Thepprasit Road, on the corner of Sukhumvit Road, Jomtien, close to Thepprasit Night Market. Being the first of its kind in Thailand it offers large discounts on high street fashion, with up to 70% off original prices, and is split into two sections: the Outlet Mall and the Premium Fashion Mall. The Outlet Mall, a two-storey shopping mall, offers bargains on selected international brands along with Thai high street brands and non-labeled clothing and swim/beach wear.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya

sources.snippet: Outlet Mall Pattaya is one of the famous shopping places in Pattaya known for its discounted shopping. The mall offers a wide range of branded products at lower prices, making it a favourite destination for shoppers looking for great deals. You can find well-known brands offering clothes, shoes, bags, and accessories at significantly reduced prices.
sources.shortName: A Guide for Travelers in 2025

sources.snippet: If your answer is yes for brand-name products at discounted prices, the Outlet Mall Pattaya is among the best places to visit in Pattaya for you. You may get up to 70% off on the top brands. You can shop for the whole family in one go in this mall from brands like Adidas and Nike to Speedo, Crocs, Levi's to Warner Bros, and Samsonite to Lacoste.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya: Get Ready to Shop in Style

sources.snippet: Other notable malls include Terminal 21, known for its themed floors that reflect global cities, and Outlet Mall Pattaya, which focuses on discounted products from various brands. Each of these malls provides unique shopping experiences, making Pattaya an attractive destination for shoppers seeking both luxury and budget-friendly options.
sources.shortName: The best Shopping malls in Pattaya

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for the best deals and considerable price cuts, there isn't any place better than the Outlet Mall. With authentic international brands offering as much as 40% to 70% off their original cost, what else could a serious shopaholic wish for?. The mall has an orange color scheme and is lined with Palm trees on the outside.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Pattaya 2024 - 19 Places to Shop & What to Buy

sources.snippet: To know: Outlet Pattaya is one of the best shopping malls in Pattaya!. There are different shops that you will enjoy going here and there shopping from, and it will be a wonderful moment you can live with your close ones!. To do: You’ll be absolutely thrilled by the special charm the mall has to offer.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya

sources.snippet: The Factory Outlet Mall in Pattaya was the first of its kind in Thailand. It offers big discounts on popular high-street fashion brands for tourists and locals alike. There are enough shops here to keep the whole family happy and year-round bargains ensure the place is always alive with activity.

sources.snippet: Outlet Mall Pattaya is a mall lack of entertainment but with outstanding discounts. It is made up two buildings – the main indoor mall and an outdoor high street-like area behind it. It has all you need.

reviews.text: A highly recommended place for shopping branded items at unbeatable prices that suit every budget. You can find things at much cheaper prices compared to other countries. I noticed that most of the ratings and reviews were from a while ago, so I went yesterday and it was a real pleasure and an excellent choice!

Underwhelming experience at Outlet Mall Pattaya.

Traffic jams are getting here,
sweltering heat, and a surprisingly quiet atmosphere.

not worth the trip.

Only for those who are looking for a discount on clothes.

1. Traffic congestion getting to the mall
2. Extremely hot weather
3. Limited retail options (mostly clothing stores)
4. Not worth the trip due to lack of variety and amenities

Recommendation: visit other attractions in Pattaya

places.generalDescription: Nestled near the iconic Ripley's Believe It Or Not, Pattaya Avenue is a vibrant shopping destination that combines leisure and retail in a delightful setting. This mini mall features around 20 cafes and restaurants, with a notable emphasis on Japanese cuisine. A highlight for many visitors is La Villa Market, Thailand's first international supermarket, which has become a favorite among expats. While it may not be the main attraction of your trip, its proximity to the beach makes it an appealing stop.

sources.snippet: The Avenue Pattaya, a lifestyle mall located in the heart of the city, offers a more relaxed shopping experience. This open-air mall is perfect for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of larger shopping centres. With a selection of boutique stores, beauty salons, and fitness centres, The Avenue caters to those looking to indulge in leisure and entertainment.
sources.shortName: Explore Pattaya's Top 5 Shopping Malls: A Shopaholic's Dream

sources.snippet: If you're a dedicated shopper, you'll appreciate the diverse stores here, catering to various tastes and preferences. Explore the latest fashion trends, discover souvenirs, and savor delicious street food in this one of the best open air shopping malls in Pattaya. This lively shopping area ensures you find whatever you desire from any of the factory outlets.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Pattaya: Get Ready to Shop in Style

sources.snippet: With its open plaza design, impressive range of restaurants and nightly market directly in front, Pattaya Avenue will bring you a pleasant shopping experience. The mall is a large indoor mall in Pattaya with a modern design. There are some factory outlets in the mall, and the price is very reasonable.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Shopping Places in Pattaya, Where to Buy in Pattaya

sources.snippet: For those who favor the outdoors, The Avenue offers a refreshing change. This open-air mall invites leisurely exploration among boutique stores and dining venues, offering a serene respite from traditional mall environments.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Pattaya Guide

sources.snippet: Built around a central water fountain, this mall has an awe-inspiring and attractive modern appearance. It is favoured by residents and tourists alike. It also has many factory outlet stores.

places.name: Pattaya Avenue

reviews.text: Absolutely delicious! These smoothies are fresh, full of flavor, and perfectly blended-no artificial stuff, just real ingredients. The staff is super friendly, prices are fair, and it's the perfect refreshment on a hot day. Highly recommended, I'll definitely be back!

Pattaya Avenue is a wonderful spot to visit with a lively atmosphere. A highlight is the nearby food court offering a variety of dishes at very affordable prices. The combination of this vibrant area and cheap food options makes it a perfect place to enjoy. Highly recommend checking out both!

Outdoor shopping mall located very close to Centra at 2nd road in Pattaya. You will only find shops and quite a few street stalls at ground level floor. The rest seems abandoned or closed on the other floors. Not really a place you need to go visit when there are so many other options to choose from in Pattaya. But go there and judge day place for yourself. Maybe it's something for you even though it wasn't for me. I won't prioritise to return to this place, maybe after sunset just to see the colourful lighting here
